author: Robinson & Cole LLP
title: Privacy Tip #410 â€“ Parents: Take a Hard Look at Nebraskaâ€™s Complaint Against TikTok
text: [Nebraska recently filed suit](https://www.dataprivacyandsecurityinsider.com/2024/08/details-of-state-of-nebraska-and-doj-complaints-against-tiktok/) against TikTok, and the details of the harms associated with using TikTok by children are outlined in the [complaint](https://ago.nebraska.gov/news/released-excerpts-internal-tiktok-documents). Although the complaint seeks redress only for Nebraskans, the allegations are relevant to parents in all states. We expect our state and federal governments to make laws that protect children from the sale and marketing of harmful products, such as alcohol, tobacco, drugs, and pornography. According to allegations by the Nebraska Attorney General, using TikTok is just as harmful to the health and well-being of children as alcohol, tobacco, and drugs. The use of TikTok by children is addicting. TikTok knows it, and it is marketing specifically to children because they are unable to understand dangers of its use. TikTok is not restricting the content that children can view, including â€œmature and inappropriate content, content related to eating disorders, sadness and suicide, and pornography.â€ Parents: you canâ€™t rely on TikTok to protect your child, particularly after reading Nebraskaâ€™s complaint. Take a hard look at the complaint so you can understand how TikTok is harming your child.â€”

author: Granada Hoy
title: Espectacular lluvia de peluches en el Palacio de los Deportes de Granada
text: El Palacio de los Deportes ha vivido este jueves un momento especial en el descanso del partido del CovirÃ¡n Granada ante el Lenovo Tenerife al caer desde las gradas del Palacio miles de peluches a la pista. Ha sido con motivo de la quinta lluvia de peluches, en la que FundaciÃ³n Caja Rural Granada apoya al FundaciÃ³n CB Granada. Fueron los propios aficionados los encargados de lanzar sus peluches a la pista en un nÃºmero de miles. Tal y como detallÃ³ Poli ServiÃ¡n, responsable de FundaciÃ³n Caja Rural Granada, como patrocinadora oficial de esta acciÃ³n solidaria y del club, se hizo entrega este mismo jueves de 400 peluches para impulsar esta iniciativa solidaria que persigue â€œllevar este regalo navideÃ±o a los hogares de las familias con menos recursosâ€. TambiÃ©n en los dÃ­as previos se pudieron entregar los peluches en la oficina del club. Sorteo Todas las personas que colaboraron recibieron una papeleta para participar en el sorteo de una camiseta de Pere TomÃ¡s, una bufanda y un peluche del FundaciÃ³n CB Granada. FundaciÃ³n CB Granada y FundaciÃ³n Caja Rural Granada harÃ¡n entrega de todo lo recolectado a varias asociaciones sin Ã¡nimo de lucro, como INPAVI o la asociaciÃ³n vecinal CaserÃ­a de Montijo, para el reparto al mÃ¡ximo nÃºmero de hogares posible.

author: Kelsey Anderson
title: City of Rockford declares snow emergency, parking | News | wrex.com
text: ROCKFORD, Ill. â€” As of 10:30 a.m. on Friday, March 22, the City of Rockford has declared a citywide snow emergency. Parking on the even side is effective immediately. On Saturday, March 23, parking on the odd side begins at 8:00 a.m. Police will issue $60 parking tickets to vehicles that are parked on the wrong side of the street. If it's snowing, the City of Rockford says that it's safe to assume that the Odd/Even Parking is in effect. The area between 20th Street west to Kishwaukee Street, Harrison Avenue north to Rural Street has been problematic for the City Crews to plow during past storms because cars have been parked on both sides of the street. Residents are urged to move their vehicles either on the street or to the appropriate side of the street as specified by the odd/even parking. If your street is marked as "No Parking" on one side of the street, the Snow Emergency Declaration enables you to legally park in the restricted area during the time that the Snow Emergency Declaration is in effect. Don't assume that you can move your car when the street is plowed. Your car must remain parked appropriately until after the Snow Emergency has been lifted.

author: zaid_qaissieh
title: Devrim Ã–zkan and Lucas Torreira romance ends after a heated argument over her spending 3 million TL on luxury items | Al Bawaba
text: ALBAWABA - Galatasaray player Lucas Torreira and actress Devrim Ã–zkan split up. Lucas Torreira and his boyfriend Devrim Ã–zkan's renowned love story has come to a close. Was the breakup between Devrim Ã–zkan and Torreira finalized, and what caused it? The renowned romance between Lucas Torreira, star of Galatasaray, a prominent Super League team, and his boyfriend Devrim Ã–zkan has come to an end. The renowned footballer allegedly got into a heated argument with the stunning actress because her extravagant desires caused him financial difficulties. For some time, Torreira had harbored feelings for the renowned actor Devrim Ã–zkan. Recently, the pair went on a little getaway to the Aegean Sea, where they spent New Year's Eve together. It was a shock to the pair when each other unfollowed them on Instagram after they had just posted heartfelt comments about loving one another. Photos of Torreira and Devrim Ã–zkan shot together were also deleted from their profiles. An argument terminated Devrim Ã–zkan and Torreira's love, according to MÃ¼ge DaÄŸÄ±stanlÄ±, host of the AramÄ±zda KalmasÄ±n show. Rumor has it that the sound of yelling and fighting roused everyone from their slumber at Torreira's house in the wee hours of the morning. The football player became worn out of Devrim Ã–zkan's extravagant and never-ending demands. The demands of Devrim Ã–zkan, including a $400,000 watch, luxury shoes, and bags, added up to 3 million TL to Torreira's costs.

author: Redazione
title: Ancora uno sciopero dei trasporti, stop bus e corriere per 24 ore
text:
[Cronaca](/cronaca/)
Ancora uno sciopero dei trasporti, stop bus e corriere per 24 ore
Si svolgerÃ , nel rispetto delle fasce di garanzia, ma i servizi di trasporto pubblico urbano, suburbano ed extraurbano non saranno garantiti
QUI PER ISCRIVERSI AL CANALE WHATSAPP DI BOLOGNATODAY
Dopo lo
stop del 9 settembre, un nuovo sciopero dei trasporti di Ã¨ stato proclamato dai sindacati di basi per il 20 settembre che coinvolge gli autoferrotranvieri, settore che, riporta Usb nella nota "continuano a denunciare le pesanti condizioni di lavoro a cui sono sottoposti e la continua aggressione ai diritti piÃ¹ elementari - con - salari di ingresso al di sotto delle 7 euro lâ€™ora, carichi di lavoro in barba a ogni normativa sulla sicurezza sul lavoro e del servizio pubblico reso, la gravosa responsabilitÃ Ì€ civile e penale della mansione e le crescenti penalizzazioni economiche ulteriormente inasprite dallâ€™attuale crisi economica sono la perfetta micidiale miscela con la quale si continua ad aggredire i lavoratori".
Lo sciopero Tper a Bologna e Imola
Negli orari di sciopero, i servizi di trasporto pubblico urbano, suburbano ed extraurbano non saranno garantiti. Per il personale viaggiante dei servizi automobilistici e filoviari Tper dei bacini di servizio di Bologna e Ferrara (bus e corriere) lo sciopero di 24 ore si svolgerÃ , nel rispetto delle fasce di garanzia, dalle ore 8.30 alle ore 16.30 e dalle ore 19.30 a fine servizio.
Per i mezzi urbani, suburbani ed extraurbani del bacino di Bologna saranno garantite solamente le corse dal capolinea centrale verso periferia, e viceversa, con orario di partenza fino alle ore 8.15 al mattino e fino alle ore 19.15 alla sera.
Lo sciopero riguarda anche il personale dedicato dei People mover, il cui servizio potrebbe non essere garantito nel corso dellâ€™intera giornata di venerdÃ¬ 20 settembre.
Per le linee urbane di Imola verranno garantite tutte le corse complete in partenza dalla stazione ferroviaria, o dall'autostazione, fino alle ore 8.20 al mattino e fino alle ore 19.20 alla sera.
Per i mezzi urbani, extraurbani e del servizio Taxibus di Ferrara saranno garantite solamente le corse dai capilinea periferici, centrali e intermedi con orario di partenza fino alle ore 8.15 al mattino e fino alle ore 19.15 alla sera.
Durante lo sciopero, al call-center telefonico 051-290290 sarÃ  garantita la presenza di un operatore.
Atri scioperi
Il 16 settembre, sempre per 24 ore, Osp Sgb ha proclamato il fermo dalle ore 8, del personale della societÃ  Gsa addetto al pronto intervento antincendio d primo soccorso del tratto Incisa-Sasso Marconi della autostrada A1.
Il 19, i sindacati confederali hanno indetto lo sciopero del personale Rfi della manutenzione dell infrastrutture di Bologna.

author: La RÃ©daction
title: Pour sauver son restaurant... il l'inonde sous un mÃ¨tre d'eau
text:
Pour sauver son restaurant... il l'inonde sous un mÃ¨tre d'eau
Face Ã  la montÃ©e record de l'Ohio, un restaurateur du Kentucky a pris une dÃ©cision radicale. Son Ã©tablissement est dÃ©sormais sous un mÃ¨tre d'eauâ€¦ mais c'est lui qui en a tournÃ© le robinet.
Chaque annÃ©e, les crues de certains fleuves menacent villes et campagnes, provoquant parfois des dÃ©gÃ¢ts considÃ©rables. Si en France on pense Ã  la Seine ou Ã  la Loire, cette fois, c'est de l'autre cÃ´tÃ© de l'Atlantique, au cÅ“ur des Ã‰tats-Unis, qu'une histoire peu banale s'est dÃ©roulÃ©e. La rÃ©gion est traversÃ©e par un fleuve imposant : l'Ohio, dont la largeur et la puissance en font un gÃ©ant comparable Ã  la Garonne ou au RhÃ´ne lors de leurs plus fortes colÃ¨res. Lorsque les pluies printaniÃ¨res s'abattent et que la fonte des neiges gonfle les eaux, la vie sur ses berges bascule.
C'est prÃ©cisÃ©ment ce qui s'est passÃ© en avril, alors que des pluies diluviennes ont fait grimper le niveau de l'Ohio Ã  son plus haut point depuis prÃ¨s de trente ans, selon les donnÃ©es d'AccuWeather. BientÃ´t, les berges envahies, les routes coupÃ©es, et les riverains impuissants devant la progression inÃ©luctable de la crue. Parmi eux, Andrew Masterson, propriÃ©taire d'un restaurant situÃ© tout prÃ¨s de l'eau, observe l'avancÃ©e du fleuve avec inquiÃ©tude. "L'eau monte plus vite que je ne l'ai jamais vu", tÃ©moigne-t-il dans une vidÃ©o publiÃ©e sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux, oÃ¹ il fait visiter son Ã©tablissement dÃ©jÃ  partiellement immergÃ©.
Alors que beaucoup auraient tentÃ© de barricader portes et fenÃªtres, ou d'Ã©vacuer ce qui pouvait l'Ãªtre, Andrew Masterson a choisi une voie radicalement diffÃ©rente. TrÃ¨s vite, il rÃ©alise qu'avec de tels volumes d'eau, rien ne pourra empÃªcher la crue d'entrer. Mais il refuse de laisser son restaurant Ãªtre envahi par l'eau sale et limoneuse du fleuve, qui s'infiltre partout, laisse une boue difficile Ã  nettoyer, et dÃ©truit mobilier et Ã©quipements. Il dÃ©cide alors d'inonder lui-mÃªme son restaurant, mais cette fois, avec de l'eau propre.
Dans sa vidÃ©o, il raconte en dÃ©tail cette opÃ©ration hors du commun. Avec l'aide de son Ã©quipe, il ouvre les robinets, actionne une pompe et laisse monter l'eau, vÃ©rifiant piÃ¨ce aprÃ¨s piÃ¨ce le niveau atteint. " L'eau que nous utilisons est cristalline. Elle garde l'eau boueuse Ã  l'extÃ©rieur ", explique-t-il, montrant du doigt la diffÃ©rence frappante entre l'intÃ©rieur et l'extÃ©rieur du bÃ¢timent. Il prend soin de dÃ©brancher tous les appareils Ã©lectriques, de mettre en sÃ©curitÃ© le matÃ©riel et d'anticiper la suite. Tout est pensÃ© pour limiter les dÃ©gÃ¢ts et surtout, faciliter le nettoyage une fois la crue terminÃ©e.
DerriÃ¨re cette idÃ©e surprenante se cache un raisonnement physique simple mais efficace. En inondant son restaurant avec de l'eau propre avant que la crue n'atteigne un niveau critique, Andrew Masterson Ã©quilibre la pression : l'eau du fleuve, chargÃ©e de dÃ©bris et de boue, ne peut plus s'infiltrer par la force dans les murs ou les fondations. Cela protÃ¨ge l'intÃ©gritÃ© du bÃ¢timent et, surtout, Ã©vite un nettoyage colossal et des rÃ©parations coÃ»teuses. "Si de toute faÃ§on l'eau doit rentrer, autant choisir laquelle", rÃ©sume-t-il. Cette stratÃ©gie inÃ©dite devrait lui permettre d'Ã©conomiser des milliers de dollars, et surtout de rouvrir plus vite, au bÃ©nÃ©fice de toute l'Ã©quipe.

author: Emmet Ryan
title: ChatGPT is running before it can walk
text:
The 1970 film Colossus: The Forbin Project could have been a run-of-the-mill warning of technology betraying its masters. Instead, it told a tale that is all too familiar in the reaction to ChatGPT-5.
In the film, the US government hands over full control of its nuclear arsenal to a supercomputer, the aforementioned Colossus, as it can calculate more quickly than any human and act more rationally when the stakes are potentially catastrophic.
Its lead designer is one Charles Forbin, a brilliant scientific mind convinced of his systemâ€™s ability to serve humanity.
That is, of course, until its definition of how best to serve humanity differs from that of its creators. Forbin believes he can outwit it to take back control but is mistaken as his best-laid plans are defeated by Colossus.
Enter GPT-5, the latest iteration of artificial intelligence tool ChatGPT that has caught the imagination of its 700 million weekly users, for good and bad.
At that scale, ChatGPT and its assorted iterations, including GPT-5, is effectively a public utility without any of the safeguards or, really, competencies expected from one.
At a regulatory level, the European Union has been faster to act than with most technologies but even it is still playing catch-up. The rest of the worldâ€™s performance in this regard is largely weaker. That means basic tenets such as fairness, reliability or accountability really arenâ€™t in place.
All of which makes sense when you consider that these 700 million users are effectively part of an ongoing live test. Mass adoption has comfortably outpaced any form of structured oversight.
That should give Sam Altman, the founder and face of OpenAI, which is behind the project, pause for thought. His product is iterating so quickly that his trust in the process ought to be tempered somewhat.
When a tool can shape the opinions of and actions of hundreds of millions of people, itâ€™s best to not have it unleashed complete with a heap of glitches
Altmanâ€™s own hype hasnâ€™t helped matters. Describing GPT-5 as offering a PhD level of insight upon its launch was brash but proven to be problematic when early flaws in spelling and geography were caught. Altman has rolled back somewhat on that description but he still believes in the vision.
All of these early flaws have, as with previous versions, been greeted with the same excuse. Itâ€™s just how AI works and the system needs time to adapt.
That would be fine were its testing phase enclosed to some degree. Instead it is used widely in schools, businesses and in public services. Using ChatGPT as a sounding board for ideas has become normalised.
With a fully polished product that needs only minor tweaks, thatâ€™s not all that bad. When GPT-5 clearly has all kinds of issues still to amend, it can needlessly impact the way all of us work and live.
Use of generative AI has become normalised more quickly than any other technology of note in living memory. Personal computers became commercially viable in the 1970s but they didnâ€™t hit this level of usage until this century. Smartphones took 15 years from widespread release to reach 700 million users, while even Facebook needed seven years.
It has taken ChatGPT just two years to match this level of public use. Cultural acceptance is happening more quickly than risk assessment can manage.
There didnâ€™t seem to be a need to rush GPT-5. OpenAI may be among the most discussed businesses in existence but its existing ChatGPT models were already doing enough to keep the public enraptured. There was time to breathe and think before rolling out GPT-5 on a mass scale. Time to work out what type of generative AI it ought to be, to consider the potential for errors large and small.
In simple terms, there was time to get the product right.
That leaves the question of who is in charge. OpenAI isnâ€™t the only player in town when it comes to generative AI but it is the one capturing the public interest. The power and vision of this technology is concentrated in one company, which regulators have still yet to fully comprehend.
Regulation doesnâ€™t exist to slow innovation. As our water and electricity services or the professional services we might use in work show, it is in place to give clear guard rails. Once something reaches a utility level of use, there needs to be greater oversight to ensure safe and cohesive provision of these services.
When a tool can shape the opinions of and actions of hundreds of millions of people, itâ€™s best to not have it unleashed complete with a heap of glitches.
Governments, businesses and citizens want generative AI to work. Yes, there are opponents to its raw principle but there is a clear support for a tool that is shaped well, one that can manage the mundane and make life easier for the rest of us. GPT-5 is clearly not that, at least not in the version it was released.
Iâ€™m not worried that GPT-5 will be given the nuclear codes. What concerns me is that Altman will trumpet a version he believes capable of handling something important to society to world leaders before he knows what it will do. Whoops wonâ€™t cut it when that happens.
